name: Draw2DElement
description: The `Draw2DElement` class is a rendering component that wraps a `Draw2D` instance and provides it with positioning, scaling, rotation, and z-indexing capabilities. This class allows you to treat a `Draw2D` object as a transformable element within a parent container, enabling complex layouts and animations.
overview:
Draw2DElement acts as a bridge between the powerful 2D drawing capabilities of `Draw2D` and the flexible positioning system of render components, making it possible to create sophisticated HUDs, overlays, and interactive visual interfaces.

Key Features:
- Position Control: Precise x/y positioning with parent-relative coordinates
- Scaling: Dynamic scaling with size constraints
- Rotation: Clockwise rotation with optional center-point rotation
- Z-Indexing: Layer ordering control for overlapping elements
- Parent Integration: Seamless integration with IDraw2D parent containers
- Alignment Support: Built-in alignment utilities for easy positioning

constructors.signature: Draw2DElement(Draw2D draw2D, int x, int y, IntSupplier width, IntSupplier height, int zIndex, float scale, float rotation)
constructors.description: Constructs a new `Draw2DElement` instance, wrapping a `Draw2D` object and setting its initial position, size suppliers, z-index, scale, and rotation.

parameters.name: draw2D
parameters.description: The internal Draw2D instance to be wrapped by this element.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The initial x-coordinate of the element relative to its parent.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The initial y-coordinate of the element relative to its parent.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: A supplier function for the element's width.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: A supplier function for the element's height.

parameters.name: zIndex
parameters.description: The initial z-index for rendering order.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: The initial scale factor for the element.

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.description: The initial clockwise rotation angle in degrees.

methods.name: getDraw2D
methods.description: Returns the internal Draw2D instance that this element is wrapping.

methods.name: setX
methods.description: Sets the x-position of this element relative to its parent.
examples:
const element = // ... obtain Draw2DElement
element.setX(100); // Move to x=100

methods.name: getX
methods.description: Gets the current x-position of this element.

methods.name: setY
methods.description: Sets the y-position of this element relative to its parent.
examples:
const element = // ... obtain Draw2DElement
element.setY(200); // Move to y=200

methods.name: getY
methods.description: Gets the current y-position of this element.

methods.name: setPos
methods.description: Sets both x and y positions simultaneously.
examples:
const element = // ... obtain Draw2DElement
element.setPos(50, 75); // Move to (50, 75)

methods.name: setWidth
methods.description: Sets the width of this element and creates a fixed-size supplier. Throws `IllegalArgumentException` if width is negative
examples:
const element = // ... obtain Draw2DElement
element.setWidth(200); // Set width to 200 pixels

methods.name: getWidth
methods.description: Gets the current width of this element by evaluating the width supplier.

methods.name: setHeight
methods.description: Sets the height of this element and creates a fixed-size supplier. Throws `IllegalArgumentException` if height is negative
examples:
const element = // ... obtain Draw2DElement
element.setHeight(150); // Set height to 150 pixels

methods.name: getHeight
methods.description: Gets the current height of this element by evaluating the height supplier.

methods.name: setSize
methods.description: Convenience method to set both width and height simultaneously.
examples:
const element = // ... obtain Draw2DElement
element.setSize(300, 200); // Set size to 300x200 pixels

methods.name: setScale
methods.description: Sets the scale factor for this element. Scale affects both size and visual appearance. Throws `IllegalArgumentException` if scale is not positive

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: The new scale factor (must be greater than 0)

examples:
const element = // ... obtain Draw2DElement
element.setScale(1.5); // Make element 50% larger
element.setScale(0.5); // Make element 50% smaller

methods.name: getScale
methods.description: Gets the current scale factor of this element.

methods.name: setRotation
methods.description: Sets the rotation angle for this element in degrees. Positive values rotate clockwise.
examples:
const element = // ... obtain Draw2DElement
element.setRotation(45); // Rotate 45 degrees clockwise
element.setRotation(-90); // Rotate 90 degrees counter-clockwise

methods.name: getRotation
methods.description: Gets the current rotation angle of this element.

methods.name: setRotateCenter
methods.description: Sets whether rotation should occur around the element's center point or its origin.

parameters.name: rotateCenter
parameters.description: Whether to rotate around the center

examples:
const element = // ... obtain Draw2DElement
element.setRotateCenter(true);  // Rotate around center
element.setRotateCenter(false); // Rotate around top-left corner

methods.name: isRotatingCenter
methods.description: Gets whether this element is configured to rotate around its center point.

methods.name: setZIndex
methods.description: Sets the z-index for render ordering. Higher values appear on top.
examples:
const element = // ... obtain Draw2DElement
element.setZIndex(10); // Render above elements with lower z-index

methods.name: getZIndex
methods.description: Gets the current z-index of this element.

methods.name: setParent
methods.description: Sets the parent container for this element. This is typically called automatically when adding elements to a container.
